         <title>This Is An Outrage!: China Bans Erotic Banana Eating Video Streaming</title>
         <description><img alt="china-ban-on-streaming-bananas.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/12/china-ban-on-streaming-bananas.jpg" width="640" height="419" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

China recently banned <a href="http://www.bbc.com/news/blogs-news-from-elsewhere-36226141">the erotic consumption of bananas </a>on the country's live-streaming video sites in an attempt to eradicate "inappropriate and erotic" content that "harms social morality."  Wow.  If banana-licking is really your concern, I hope you've already gotten rid of literally everything else.

<blockquote>New regulations mean that live-streaming sites must monitor all their output round-the-clock to ensure nothing untoward is going on, keeping an eye out for any "erotic" banana-eating, according to New Express Daily. It's not just fruit that's on their radar though - the paper adds that wearing stockings and suspenders while hosting a live stream is now also forbidden.


And plenty think people will be able to get around the banana ban: "They will all start eating cucumbers, and if that's no good, yams," one user says.</blockquote>

I posted an example video after the jump for educational purposes, which, I'm going to be honest, I was not very impressed by.  That lady is seriously one of the worst banana eaters I've ever seen.  In the whole minute long video she doesn't even take a single bite.  Does she even know how to eat bananas?  They're not popsicles, it's not gonna melt in your mouth.  What the hell are you waiting for?  CHOMP CHOMP CHOMP IT LIKE AN ALLIGATOR.  

Keep going for the video.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/fk2gVunpIEQ" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
         <link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~3/fk2gVunpIEQ/this-is-an-outrage-china-bans-erotic-ban.php</link>
         <guid isPermaLink="false">http://geekologie.com/2016/05/this-is-an-outrage-china-bans-erotic-ban.php</guid>
        
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">ahahhahaha yams nobody wants to see somebody eat a yam i don't care how sensually you can do it</category>

          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">morality</category>

      <item>
         <title>Kaboom!: Skipping A Sodium Disk Across A River</title>
         <description><img alt="skipping-sodium.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/12/skipping-sodium.jpg" width="640" height="452" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

PROTIP: Loud, keep your speakers in check.  

Mixing sodium and water causes a violent chemical reaction (my favorite kind).   So what happens when you try<a href="http://sploid.gizmodo.com/skipping-a-pound-of-sodium-across-a-lake-is-way-more-fu-1776180868"> to skip a pound disk of sodium across a river</a>?  EXPLOSIVE MAGIC.  Like a wizard with diarrhea.  The sodium disk doesn't really skip that much though, it goes airborne after the first big explosion.  When reached for comment about the experiment, local residents didn't return my calls because they were fish and they were all killed.

Hit the jump for the video, then let's try eating pure sodium.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/ixWPzfATyq4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
         <link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~3/ixWPzfATyq4/kaboom-skipping-a-sodium-disk-across-a-r.php</link>

      <item>
         <title>Incredible Game Of Thrones Character Face Pancakes</title>
         <description><img alt="game-of-thrones-character-pancakes.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/12/game-of-thrones-character-pancakes.jpg" width="640" height="1298" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

This is a video of pancake artist Dancakes (I see what you did there you wily devil!) cooking pancakes <a href="http://www.foodbeast.com/news/game-of-thrones-pancakes/">of Game Of Thrones character's faces</a>.  He's clearly got the skills.  I wonder how good the pancakes taste though.  You think they're delicious, or you think to get the consistency he needs to draw the batter isn't that good?  I wonder about these things.  Also, why my nipple hair grows back so fast.  I feel like I just shaved it.  You know I accidentally cut my nipple shaving my chest once.  That was painful.  "You should try breastfeeding."  Sure, just hold me like a baby and point me at a tit.  

Keep going for the video.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/PDgQCpZOH6I" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

      <item>
         <title>What A Little Jerk!: Monkey Steals Food From Sloth, Sloth Too Slow To Do Anything About It</title>
         <description><img alt="monkey-steals-from-sloth.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/12/monkey-steals-from-sloth.jpg" width="640" height="405" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

This is a very short video from the Sóstó Zoo in Hungary of a little squirrel monkey stealing a piece of food right out of a sloth's hand, who is far too slow to do anything about it but make an angry face.  That poor sloth.  Who goes around stealing people's food?  "Says the guy who just ate the other half of somebody's sub from the break-room fridge."  What?  That was mine!  I just don't remember buying it or eating the first half.

Hit the jump for the video.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/aSopcqGetVQ" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

      <item>
         <title>POV Ride On Tallest, Fastest, Longest Dive Roller Coaster</title>
         <description><img alt="pov-valravn-coaster.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/12/pov-valravn-coaster.jpg" width="640" height="408" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

This<a href="http://hedonistica.com/art-and-design/pov-on-valravn/"> is a POV ride on the just opened Valravn dive coaster</a> at Cedar Point in Ohio.  The Valravn is currently the tallest (223 feet, with an initial drop of 214 feet), fastest (75MPH) and longest (3,415 feet) dive roller coaster in the world.  Man, that first drop looks like a DOOZY.  Everybody's laughing and having a good time, then, pure terror.  I'm pretty sure that guy who yells in bursts passed out because I didn't hear him for the rest of the ride.  That would be me.  Oh who am I kidding, I couldn't ride that.  Even carousels make me nervous.  I am a delicate creature, like a butterfly, but uglier like one of those hairy moths.

Keep going for the video.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/x2ZNCFUBSzc" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

      <item>
         <title>Yum: DNA From Rats, Human Found In Veggie Burgers</title>
         <description><img alt="veggie-burger-analysis.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/12/veggie-burger-analysis.jpg" width="640" height="320" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

In news that shouldn't surprise anybody who's familiar with how food is made, a recent study by food analysts at Clear Labs <a href="http://www.foxnews.com/leisure/2016/05/11/dna-from-humans-rats-and-other-animals-found-in-some-veggie-burgers/">discovered a bunch of yummy ingredients</a> in veggie burgers that aren't supposed to be there, including rat and human DNA.  But I thought that's what gives the patty it's unique flavor.

<blockquote>In a sample of 89 veggie burgers collected from a range of brands, Clear Labs identified several problems with "substitution, hygienic issues, and pathogenic contamination."


One purported "black bean burger" was found to contain no black beans at all, according to the study, while four of the veggie burgers tested did contain pathogenic DNA that could lead to food poisoning.</blockquote>

Who cares?  None of this is going to stop me from eating veggie burgers.  I guarantee of all the things that could kill me, I'm not going out via veggie patty.  Besides, they found traces of DNA, it's not like the found a whole finger or rat tail.  And props to the company selling the black bean burger with no black beans in it.  That is ballsy.  Or maybe they're actually sold as black bean <em>flavored</em> burgers or black bean <em>style</em> burgers.  There are ways to get around these things you see.  If there's one thing I know it's underhandedness.

Thanks to Jarod, who just watched me drop a chip with dip on the floor and pick it up and eat it without breaking eye contact.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/snTOsKX_xkI" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
         <link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~3/snTOsKX_xkI/yum-dna-from-rats-human-found-in-veggie.php</link>
         <guid isPermaLink="false">http://geekologie.com/2016/05/yum-dna-from-rats-human-found-in-veggie.php</guid>
        
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">eating things</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">food</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">i eat off the floor</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">whatever</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">who cares</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">you could tell me the burger i have in my hand has human or rat DNA in it and i guarantee i'd still eat it like one of those chicks in a carl's jr or hardee's ad</category>
        
         <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:30:48 -0500</pubDate>
      <feedburner:origLink>http://geekologie.com/2016/05/yum-dna-from-rats-human-found-in-veggie.php</feedburner:origLink></item>
      
      <item>
         <title>Winnie The Pooh Voice Actor Reads Darth Vader's Lines As Pooh, Darkwing Duck</title>
         <description><img alt="winnie-the-pooh-darth-vader.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/12/winnie-the-pooh-darth-vader.jpg" width="640" height="377" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

This<a href="https://www.geeksaresexy.net/2016/05/05/voice-winnie-pooh-reads-darth-vaders-lines-star-wars-video/"> is a video from ConnectiCon 2013</a> of voice actor Jim Cummings reading Darth Vader lines as both Winnie The Pooh and Darkwing Duck.  It's pretty great.  I just wish there was a way to mute the sound of the audience.  I came here to hear Winnie The Pooh read Darth Vader's lines, I didn't come here to listen to a bunch of youngsters hoot and holler.  Oh my God I'm a grandpa.  Is it time for my lunch yet?  Turn up the television I can't hear.

Keep going for the video.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/8ssbcVntTYE" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

      <item>
         <title>Dang: Unicorns Were Real, Disappointing Looking</title>
         <description><img alt="siberian-unicorn.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/12/siberian-unicorn.jpg" width="640" height="384" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

This is artist Heinrich Harder's interpretation of <em>Elasmotherium sibiricum</em> (aka the Siberian Unicorn), a giant land mammal that, until recently, scientists believe went extinct some 350,000 years ago.  But with the discovery of a a skull in the Pavlodar region of Kazakhstan, scientists now believe the unicorn<a href="https://www.theguardian.com/science/2016/mar/29/siberian-unicorn-extinct-humans-fossil-kazakhstan"> went extinct only 29,000 years ago</a>, and walked alongside (or, more than likely, ran away from) modern humans.  I would have lassoed one and tamed it and ridden it as my war mount.

<blockquote>Unfortunately, despite its sizable horn, the "Siberian unicorn" looked more like a rhinoceros than the mythical creature its nickname refers to. It was about 6 feet tall, 15 feet long, and weighed about 9,000 pounds, making it more comparable to a woolly mammoth than a horse.</blockquote>

That's exactly what I was about to say.  If this thing was a unicorn then unicorns still exist and we just call them rhinos.  The tears from these things are probably worthless for making potions.  It's important to use only the purest ingredients or your potions can backfire.  Case in point: One time I was making a love potion that called for the wings of a sparrow but I used leftover Hooter's hot wings instead and the girl that was supposed to fall in love with me stabbed me in the head six times and left me for dead.

Thanks to Christina, who agrees that does not look like the kind of unicorn any self-respecting princess would ride.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/6XKeYoYesRg" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
         <link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~3/6XKeYoYesRg/dang-unicorns-were-real-disappointing-lo.php</link>
         <guid isPermaLink="false">http://geekologie.com/2016/05/dang-unicorns-were-real-disappointing-lo.php</guid>
        
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">animals</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">disappointment</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">extinct</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">iffy</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">mythical beasts</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">questionable</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">the circle of life</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">unicorn</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">whoever named this thing should be banned from naming things</category>

      <item>
         <title>Way To Go: Opera Singer Scares Penguins In Antarctica</title>
         <description><img alt="penguins-run-from-opera.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/11/penguins-run-from-opera.jpg" width="640" height="403" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

This is a short video of opera singer/penguin harasser Nick Allen <a href="http://laughingsquid.com/an-opera-singers-impromptu-aria-sends-a-waddle-of-nervous-penguins-fleeing-for-the-hills/">performing an impromptu aria</a> in Antarctica and sending all the local penguins running for the hills.  Way to go, Nick.  What did those penguins ever do to you?  Have they ever come to one of your performances and started a commotion?  They were just trying to go about their waddling little lives when Mister Pretty Voice decides to to come along and interrupt their day.  Not cool.  Cold.  Just like Antarctica.  Man, I'm getting good at this whole coming full circle thing.  <em>♫ It's the ciiiiiiiiircle of life, and something something ♫</em> "And it moves us all."  Huh?  "Those are the lyrics."  Nothing moves me but my mom yelling dinner time.

Keep going for the video.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/5s35ihGxvlk" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

      <item>
         <title>Lollipops That Look Like The Planets In Our Solar System</title>
         <description><img alt="planet-lollipops-1.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/11/planet-lollipops-1.jpg" width="640" height="526" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

These <a href="http://technabob.com/blog/2016/05/11/planet-lollipops/">are the Planetary Lollipops</a> available <a href="http://www.thinkgeek.com/product/ivti/">from ThinkGeek</a> (previously:<a href="http://geekologie.com/2012/09/start-counting-owl-edible-planet-lollipo.php"> these ones made by an Etsy seller </a>who clearly got their idea stolen unless they had already stolen it from somebody else).  $30 gets a set of 10 lollipops including all the planets plus the sun and Pluto which is annoying I have to mention instead of just being lumped in with the planets.  Each one has a different flavor.  Uranus is blackberry flavored, which I approve of and hope they did on purpose.  I mean, there's no way they didn't do that on purpose, right?  They only way it could be any clearer is if they made it anise flavored.  

Keep going for a couple more shots including one of Kevin James about to bite earth in half.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/aryF9fljwwE" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

      <item>
         <title>Classics: Guy Comes In For Job Interview, Mistakenly Gets Interviewed On Live TV As Industry Expert</title>
         <description><img alt="guy-goma-bbc-interview.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/11/guy-goma-bbc-interview.jpg" width="640" height="380" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

<em>"Oh shit" -- this guy</em>

It's been ten years since BBC data support job applicant Guy Goma was mistaken for music industry expert Guy Kewney and put on live air to discuss the court case between Apple Computer and the Beatles' record label Apple Corps.  If you've never seen the video it's a treat, like frozen yogurt with sprinkles.  He nails it.  Unfortunately, Guy did not get the job he came for, which is a shame because clearly this man is a quick thinker and team player.  If I had owned a business ten years ago I would have scooped him up and made him CEO.  You goofed, BBC.  This guy could have been a stand-in for any expert you ever needed and nobody would have known the wiser.  I remember when I first watched the video ten years  thinking to myself, "Damn, now that's an expert who really knows his stuff."  

Keep going for the video and a transcript of the interview.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/ZUUZuWmK_5w" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

      <item>
         <title>Thanks, Internet: Cat Wearing A Hat Eating A Cake</title>
         <description><img alt="cat-eating-cake-1.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/11/cat-eating-cake-1.jpg" width="640" height="480" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

These are a handful of pictures <a href="http://www.boredpanda.com/cat-enjoying-a-cake-is-all-we-need-this-monday/">of a cat wearing a hat eating a little cake</a>.  Unfortunately, there isn't much more information about just what the hell is going on here.  Is that a regular cake?  Is it a special tuna flavored cat cake?  How is that hat staying on? Is it the cat's birthday?  I bet it's the cat's birthday.  It's sad to think there are cats out there having nicer birthdays than I've ever had.  You know what kind of cake I had for my last birthday?  A $3.29 bran muffin.  I bought it for myself from a coffee shop when I realized nobody was coming to my party at the skating rink.  A bran muffin is worse than no cake at all, especially when you accidentally overdraft your bank account to pay for it.  And I consider that was one of my better recent birthdays.  

Keep going for several more shots of Miss Icing Face.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/0kjW0TtoCJI" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

      <item>
         <title>Was Only A Matter Of Time: Pizza Engagement Ring Box</title>
         <description><img alt="pizza-engagement-ring-box.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/10/pizza-engagement-ring-box.jpg" width="640" height="638" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

This is <a href="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/rick-and-morty-edited-to-perform-kendric.php">an engagement ring box made from pizza</a> by Vinnie's Pizzeria in Brooklyn (previously: <a href="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/prayers-do-get-answered-a-pizza-box-made.php">they're larger pizza box pizza</a> and <a href="http://geekologie.com/2015/12/pizzeria-offers-pizzas-with-smaller-pizz.php">slices on slices on slices pizza</a>.  It is perfect for your pizza loving significant other when you decide to take things to the NEXT LEVEL.  What is the next level anyways?  I am still on level 1-1 and I only have one man left so it's not looking good for me.  "Marriage."  Oh, THAT.  <em>*suicides last man into pit*</em>  I'm committed to being alone.  "Or is it nobody wants to date you?"  Somebody, anybody, just please swipe right.  I just wanna know what it feels like.

Thanks to Tiffany R, who wants to be proposed to with a taco.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/WydiEU4T1es" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

      <item>
         <title>How To: Make A Cocktail w/ A Smoke-Filled Ice Ball Inside</title>
         <description><img alt="smoke-bomb-cocktail.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/10/smoke-bomb-cocktail.jpg" width="640" height="428" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

This is a video from Cocktail Chemistry demonstrating how to make a cocktail <a href="http://laughingsquid.com/how-to-make-an-impressive-smoke-filled-ice-ball-to-crack-open-over-a-stirred-cocktail-with-a-hammer/">with a smoke-filled ice ball inside</a>.  You're supposed to break the ice ball with a small hammer, and the smoke lingers over the cocktail for a while, adding a smokey aroma.  This would probably cost at least $30 at a bar that's fancy enough to serve drinks with smoke-filled ice balls inside.  I liked how the ball didn't break the first time he hits it with the hammer.  I thought for sure he was going to accidentally hit the glass and break that.  I wonder how many times he actually did do that.  At least once, right?  One time I drank out of a beer bottle that was broken at the top and it cut my lip bad and I bled EVERYWHERE.  It looked like I'd just eaten a heart or something.  I took so many pictures.  But what I should have taken is a trip to the hospital because now my lip healed funny and it looks like I'm always snarling.  See?  I look like a wolf, right?  "Just a really ugly man."  I should hire you as my confidence coach.

Hit the jump for the video.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/vzGzio0zg9w" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
         <link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~3/vzGzio0zg9w/how-to-make-a-cocktail-w-a-smoke-filled.php</link>

      <item>
         <title>I Am Impressed: 15-Year Old Uses Ancient Star Maps To Pinpoint Lost Mayan City</title>
         <description><img alt="lost-mayan-city.jpg" src="http://geekologie.com/2016/05/10/lost-mayan-city.jpg" width="640" height="360" class="mt-image-none" style="" />

15-year old Canadian student William Gadoury <a href="http://www.journaldemontreal.com/2016/05/07/un-ado-decouvre-une-cite-maya">has discovered a lost Mayan city</a> after realizing that the brightest stars in constellations on ancient Mayan star maps<a href="http://gizmodo.com/teen-discovers-lost-maya-city-using-ancient-star-maps-1775735999"> correspond to the locations of known Mayan cities</a>.  Apparently not even adult scientists had discovered this correlation before and William makes 15-year old me look like a completely worthless shit.  

<blockquote>After studying 22 different constellations, Gadoury noticed that they neatly corresponded to the locations of 117 Mayan cities located in Mexico, Guatemala, Honduras, and El Salvador. When looking at a 23rd constellation, he was able to match two stars to known cities--but a third star remained unmatched. Using transparent overlays, Gadoury pinpointed a location deep in the thick jungles of the Yucatan Peninsula in Mexico.


"I did not understand why the Maya built their cities away from rivers, on marginal lands, and in the mountains," explained Gadoury in Le Journal de Montreal. "They must have had another reason, and as they worshiped the stars, the idea came to me to verify my hypothesis. I was really surprised and excited when I realized that the most brilliant stars of the constellations matched the largest Maya cities."</blockquote>

Smart boy.  I see a bright future for William.  <em>Bright like a star.</em>  Because this article was kind of about stars.  See how I tied everything together?  Neat like the bow on a present.  "That looks like a knot of electrical cords."  I can't do anything right.  I also didn't discover anything at age 15 except if you're taking a hot shower and point the shower head at your privates and turn the water cold real fast it'll give you a boner.

Thanks to Lizzy, nicolas and Sab, who just want to discover something before everything is already discovered.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~4/gODsiET4rAc" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
         <link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/geekologie/iShm/~3/gODsiET4rAc/i-am-impressed-15-year-old-uses-ancient.php</link>
         <guid isPermaLink="false">http://geekologie.com/2016/05/i-am-impressed-15-year-old-uses-ancient.php</guid>
        
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">ancient civilization</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">discovering things</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">heck yeah now let's go on an indiana jones style adventure into the jungle</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">i was a worthless teen and haven't improved much since then</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">impressive</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">neato</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">oh wow</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">somebody give this kid an A</category>
        
          <category domain="http://www.sixapart.com/ns/types#tag">stars</category>
        
         <pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 15:30:33 -0500</pubDate>
      <feedburner:origLink>http://geekologie.com/2016/05/i-am-impressed-15-year-old-uses-ancient.php</feedburner:origLink></item>
